title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. IV, subch. C, pt. 185 - Standards For Grades Of Apples
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. IV, subch. C, pt. 185 - Standards For Grades Of Apples

State Regulations
§ 185.1 - Grades
§ 185.2 - Color requirements
§ 185.3 - Unclassified grade and culls
§ 185.4 - Tolerances
§ 185.5 - Application of tolerances
§ 185.6 - Calculation of percentages
§ 185.7 - Condition after storage or transit
§ 185.8 - Packing requirements
§ 185.9 - Marking requirements
§ 185.10 - Definitions
§ 185.11 - Condition standards for export

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. IV, subch. C, pt. 185

Statutory authority: Agriculture and Markets Law, §§156-c, 156-d, 156-f

The following standards are practically identical with the
corresponding standards of apple grades heretofore promulgated by the Secretary
of Agriculture of the United States, commonly known as "United States Standards
for Grades of Apples". [FN2] Packing of the product in conformity with the
requirements of these standards shall not excuse failure to comply with the
provisions of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act, article 17 of the

Agriculture and Markets Law, or with applicable provisions of laws and
regulations of other States. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
